sections.title: What is Road Runner?
sections.content:
Road Runner is a powerful motion planning library designed for FTC robots. It enables precise trajectory following, advanced path planning, and smooth autonomous routines. Unlike basic drive code, Road Runner provides tools for creating complex paths and controlling your robot's movement with high accuracy.

Learn more: Official Road Runner Docs: Introduction

sections.title: Why Use Road Runner in FTC?
sections.content:
FTC autonomous challenges often require robots to move precisely and efficiently. Road Runner helps teams:
  • Follow complex paths
  • Handle localization (knowing where the robot is)
  • Chain multiple movements together
  • Reduce errors from wheel slip and drift
Compared to other libraries, Road Runner is tailored for FTC hardware and field layouts.

See: gm0: Road Runner Overview

sections.title: Basic Concepts: Trajectories, Localization, and Path Following
sections.content:
Trajectories are pre-planned paths for your robot to follow. Localization is how the robot keeps track of its position. Path following is the process of making the robot move along a trajectory as accurately as possible.

For a quick overview: Road Runner Quickstart Overview

sections.title: Simple Trajectory Example
How Road Runner Integrates with FTC SDK
sections.content:
Road Runner works alongside the FTC SDK. You initialize Road Runner in your OpMode, set up your drive class, and use its methods to build and follow trajectories.

Step-by-step guide: gm0: Road Runner Quickstart
